page.title: 01The Down West of Frome
page.content: The Central easr-west section is a fairly level down )highest point 176' above sea level) with fields and occasional woodland sloping away to the north, south and east. The land is predominantly agricultural, distributed between fifteen farms concerned with dairy cattle and arable crops, with a few beef cattle and sheep; one deals with the distribution of liquid pig-feed. The section includes the village of Buckland Dinham population approximately 366, the hamlet of Hardington and a saw-mill and timber yard. The A362 road crosses diagonally east to west. It is the main route to the educational facilities in Frome and to employment for the majority of the population in local towns and the city of Bath. It is the route of the bus service. A once-busy coal-bearing
